Articles.Content:
I am a semi-retired guy that take pleasure in metaphysics, science, philosophy and related things. My professional life consisted and consists of my Church (A.B.O.T.C.)* that support two charter non-profits, MM and MOTC. I earned a masters working during the day and attending night schools after receiving my BS/BA at the local university (ETSU*) way back in the day using a VA grant and creative financing!Ã¢â‚¬Â¦Hmmm this is sounding like a job application! Sorry, I will speed this up....I am currently living in (very far) east TN, in the mountains, and I am near the famous (or infamous depending on your opinion of auto racing) Bristol NASCAR track (good buddy!). I am working as hard as an above the knee amputee can to become 'off the grid' capable. By 'off the grid capable' I mean I am attempting to become as self sufficient as possible.

Well, my new friends, sorry for the length of this, my first 'real' post . The length is one of my most difficult to resolve problems when it comes to English grammar, the ******* of world languages as my professor made a point of saying. Was he right? H,. tyhat may be a new thread! (lol)

However all that said, I do look forward to meeting all of you soon!

EgO

Welcome EGO. Looking at your post time, you must be an early riser! I somewhat resemble those remarks ( not so much church ). Check out the Science lab forum and drop some of your pearls of wisdom on us. There are a bunch of helpful, respectful people here, glad to answer any questions you may have.
Welcome! May KSP spur your curiosity to greater heights!

Welcome!

Good luck with your studies and getting off the grid.

And KSP is definitely the place to fritter away your free time (and maybe even some time that wasn't meant to be "free").
Welcome to the forums! Glad to see another East Tennesseean on the forums.
